abstract: Notifies you of a suspended session.
overview:
## Discussion

When NI invokes this callback, the session suspends and doesn’t receive [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didUpdate:)] callbacks. NI suspends a session when the user backgrounds the app. If the user reactivates the app before NI times out the session, NI calls [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/sessionSuspensionEnded(_:)]. A suspended session won’t resume on its own. To resume the session, call [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISession/run(_:)] again, passing in your session’s configuration.

If the app stays backgrounded for too long during a suspension, NI invalidates the session (see [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didInvalidateWith:)]) and the peer user’s session invokes [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didRemove:reason:)] with `reason` [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/RemovalReason/timeout].

Additionally, the system may suspend a session for internal reasons.
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/sessionWasSuspended(_:)
crawled: 2025-12-04T10:47:14Z
---

# sessionWasSuspended(_:)

**Instance Method**

Notifies you of a suspended session.

## Declaration

```swift
optional func sessionWasSuspended(_ session: NISession)
```

## Parameters

- **session**: The session that NI suspended.

## Discussion

When NI invokes this callback, the session suspends and doesn’t receive [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didUpdate:)] callbacks. NI suspends a session when the user backgrounds the app. If the user reactivates the app before NI times out the session, NI calls [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/sessionSuspensionEnded(_:)]. A suspended session won’t resume on its own. To resume the session, call [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISession/run(_:)] again, passing in your session’s configuration.

If the app stays backgrounded for too long during a suspension, NI invalidates the session (see [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didInvalidateWith:)]) and the peer user’s session invokes [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didRemove:reason:)] with `reason` [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/RemovalReason/timeout].

Additionally, the system may suspend a session for internal reasons.

## Managing interruption

- **sessionSuspensionEnded(_:)**: Notifies you of the end of a session’s suspension.
